data.title: Triangle wrapping
data.solution:
text = input()

text += " "
line_num = 1
while text:
    line = ""
    if (i := text.rfind(" ", 0, line_num + 1)) >= 0:
        line, text = text[:i], text[i + 1:]
    print(line)
    line_num += 1
data.statement:
The publishing house you work for has decided to start printing triangular books. Your task is to wrap a single line of [[text]] into a triangular shape.

1. Words in [[text]] may contain any English letter ({{a-z}}, {{A-Z}}), digit ({{0-9}}) or punctuation ({{!"&'(),-.:;?}}). All words are separated by a single space.
2. Wrap the text by replacing some spaces with newlines. Add empty lines if needed.
3. The first line cannot be wider than 1 character, the second — 2, etc.
4. The result can contain any number of lines, but you must <<fit as many characters as possible into each line>> before moving on to the next.

<<Example:>>
{{I am Groot}} should be formatted into
`I
am


Groot`(there are no trailing spaces in each line of the output)

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

The publishing house you work for has decided to start printing triangular books. Your task is to wrap a single line of text into a triangular shape.

1. Words in text may contain any English letter (a-z, A-Z), digit (0-9) or punctuation (!"&'(),-.:;?). All words are separated by a single space.
2. Wrap the text by replacing some spaces with newlines. Add empty lines if needed.
3. The first line cannot be wider than 1 character, the second — 2, etc.
4. The result can contain any number of lines, but you must fit as many characters as possible into each line before moving on to the next.

Example:
I am Groot should be formatted into
I
am


Groot
(there are no trailing spaces in each line of the output)
Input
A single line of text.
Output
The formatted text split into lines according to the rules.
Constraints
1 ≤ length of text ≤ 100
Example
Input
I am Groot
Output
I
am


Groot
